result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Anne Renc
Initial Appearance set for May 16, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 1

2:38 p.m.  Defendant, Alexander Kucharski, appears by video, in custody from the Portage County Jail.   Atty Anne Renc appears in person on the defendant's behalf.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Initial Appearance was originally set for May 9, 2022 but this had been rescheduled to May 31, 2022.
Court finds that this is not acceptable especially since the defendant is sitting on a $25,000 cash bond.
FCC Dalkert would like this to be heard in front of the Judge and will reschedule this to May 16, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. 
Atty Anne Renc indicates that if this is not heard that she will file a Motion to Release her client from his bond conditions.
Atty Renc does have an objection to this not being heard today.
Court again reiterates the fact that this should really be heard in front of the Judge.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.

Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
State has concerns with the mental health of the defendant.

State requests a $25,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule states objections as to a cash bond and requests a signature bond.
